pkgmetadata.longdescription: Sample Size Analysis for Psychological Networks and More // An implementation of the sample size computation method for network models proposed by Constantin et al. (2021) doi:10.31234/osf.io/j5v7u The implementation takes the form of a three-step recursive algorithm designed to find an optimal sample size given a model specification and a performance measure of interest. It starts with a Monte Carlo simulation step for computing the performance measure and a statistic at various sample sizes selected from an initial sample size range. It continues with a monotone curve-fitting step for interpolating the statistic across the entire sample size range. The final step employs stratified bootstrapping to quantify the uncertainty around the fitted curve.
